bboxes.raw_text:
JACkSON'S BEAUTY SHOPPE
1898 E. Madison
AL 2-954i

Representatives of William
Patterson Lodge and Grand
Canyon Temple who left Tuesday
to attend the grand lodge in
Miami, Florida are Isiah Ward.
exalted ruler: Ruby Blackshear,
daughter ruler; Kermit eagle,
James McElroy, Maple Lee
Pratt, grand district deputies;
Esther McElroy. loyal DIT. ruler:
Norris Woods, house chairman:
Felix Raney, member, former
resident of Yuma and Howard
Kirk, 9TH regional oratorical win
ner. Howard will compete in the
grand lodge contest. also.


Everyone is invited to come
out and hear our new band led
by Richard Clark. Players In
clude Charlie Lewis, Dave Cook
and Dave Phillips.


Our new bartenders are Alfred
"Piggie" Woodbridge and Joseph
Ford.


Aug. I'll Elks bowlers are
spoons oring a Beatnik Dance do
nation ST..


Clarence Marsell is home re-
cuperating. His address is 2lo
w. Sherman.


DIT. Elizabeth Turner is re-
cuperating at her daughters
home, 1902 S. 10th St.


Bro. Charles Patterson and his
wife, Lillian, are both i'll at home,
l407 E. Coronado.


Final rites are pending for
Charlie Massey, who passed away
Aug. II at Fort Whipple.


First President chosen by a
national convention. Andrew
Jacks on.

Mrs. Alwortha Carter,
daughter of Mr.. and Mrs. Leonard
Stevens, 9l7 w. Grant, recently
returned to her home in Rome,
MY.


She had spent a month with
her parents.


John A. Henry, 1896 S. 10Th
ST., left Sunday to attend the
Omega Denver grand conclave,
Aug. 1920.


Solomon Freliz has returned
from an extended vacatin in Den
yer. He visited Mr.. and Mrs.
Isaac Moore.


DR.. and Mrs. David NJ. Solomon
planed to Denver to attend the
grand conclave of the Omeg Psi
Phi fraternity.


Walter Venerable and his two
sons, Michael and Walter, spent
five days camping at Grand Can
yon National Park.


Mr.. and Mrs. Lafayette
Winrow and family will vacation
at San Diego before school re-
opens.

The reports agreed that Miss
Moreno is able to understand the
nature of the charges against
her.


Miss Moreno is charged with
the butcher-knife Staying Sept.
10, 1868, of Grady (2X) Holly,
Is, of 1886 w. Madison, outside
market at e46 W. Buckeye
Road.


Holly was known as TX in the
Black Muslins, Negro group
which advocates complete sep
aration of black and white races.

NEW YORK Led by Tom
Skinner, an evangelist, IS Negro
churches have called for mass
meeting to act against violence
and hatred.


The churches of nine Protes-
tant denominations want to CO.
ordinate efforts of those Har-
lemites who want to end the
riots, and vandalism which has
been happening recently.


Skinner, ~ yr. old son of a
Baptist minister, asked for 100
people to volunteer for a moral
and spiritual revolution in
Harlem, not for armed ones.

A woman's legs are one of the
most observed parts of her body.
AS a result it is very important
that they should be well-groomed
at all times.


Whether at home or on a trip,
good grooming is pleasure with
new ultra smooth Cosmetic Shv-
ing Creme by Clairol. The aqua
and white container has an over
size cap enabling you to stand
the tube on end. Clairol shaving
creme adds new silky COM
plexion to your legs. It's great
for underarms, too.

BILOXI, Miss. Several Negro
children registered quietly at
formerly segregated school for
whites. They we're the first
Negroes to be integrated in a
school below the college level in
Mississippi.


A heavy guard of FBI agents
and local police we're on hand.


Biloxi is desegregating its first
grade under federal court
order.


JOB OPPORTUNITIES
City of Phoenix Apply at Isl
West Washington
Library Clerk $2l6-276 month
Water Meter Repairman $685.
$440 month


Cashier II (male only) $294-38O
month


Police Communications Dis
patcher 1924 42O month
First President to live in the
White House John Adams.

Negroes Enter


lst grade in Miss.

Ramona Tapio Moreno, %, who
is charged with the fatal stabbing
of Negro, is legally sane and
will stand trial for murder Sept.
s.


Superior Court Judge William
A. Holohan ruled Miss Moreno,
1906 w. Grant, is mentally able
to assist an attorney in her own
defense.


Judge Holohan ruled after
hearing reports of two Phoenix
psychiatrists, DR.. Paul Bin
delglas and DR.. Carl Breimer.

FOR RENT


2 bedrm., new apis. coolers, built
in range /oven. See resident mgr.
6o32 S. 22nd St. & Vineyard
Apt. 4: $3.50 including free
water, 276-825O.

First President to live in the
White House = John Adams.

j & M BARBER SHOP
1906 W. Buckeye
